entry.title: As the U.S. Races to Vaccinate Kids, Some Countries Hold Back
entry.content: Immunizing children against Covid-19 is viewed by authorities in the U.S. and elsewhere as critical to get the upper hand over the virus. But in some parts of the world, such efforts have generated deep controversy.

entry.title: Covid-19 Shots Are Reaching Poor Countries, but Not People's Arms
entry.content: While more vaccines could be delivered in the coming weeks than countries have received this year, many countries lack the fridges and facilities needed to distribute the shots and are fighting misinformation and hesitancy.

entry.title: Europe Says Belarus Is Weaponizing Migrants in 'New Type of War'
entry.content: European officials accuse Belarus of abetting human traffickers bringing migrants into their country and then of funneling the new arrivals toward the border in an effort to provoke a crisisâ€”things Belarus denies.
